page.title: 12Employment in the district
page.content: Employment in the district{(see also {p.11)}falls into 3 categories:{ {service, agricultural & light {industrial/engineering.}Estate agents, shops, banks & offices employ mainly female labour, often on a part-time basis. Some women are involved in{ {domestic}work and also{voluntary play {group}activities. Other service work draws men to Horsham{(eg with the {insurance group Sun Alliance).} Agricultural work is less dominant now because machinery usage has increased. A range of factories offers work for men and women on research, production (often assembly-line) and despatch. There is one old-established tool making firm, several light engineering works, a specialised chemical firm,two electronics firms, printers & builders etc.{Apprenticeships}are dwindling and much factory work is temporary.
